\Lqdt\Coj\ORM

\Lqdt\Coj\ORMJsonQuery

Extends the core Query class to provide support for parsing valid queries containing JSON fields properties.

jsonFieldName()

jsonFieldName(\Lqdt\Coj\ORM\string  $datfield) : String

Convert a property name given under datfield format into a valid JSON_EXTRACT short notation usable in cakePHP standard queries

Parameters

\Lqdt\Coj\ORM\string $datfield

Returns

String —

Returns Mysql valid formatted name to query JSON

Tags

method

jsonFieldName
version 1.0.0
since 1.0.0

jsonFieldsNameInString()

jsonFieldsNameInString(string  $conditions) : string

Apply jsonFieldName to every property name detected in a string

The regexp is a bit tricky to avoid collision with mail parameter value that will be enclosed by quotes

Parameters

string $conditions

String to be reworked

Returns

string —

String with parsed fields/properties

Tags

method

jsonFieldsNameInString
version 1.0.0
since 1.0.0

jsonStatement()

jsonStatement(string  $field, mixed  $value) : mixed

Parse a statement with JSON_EXTRACT short notation. It will convert usual operators to fit a mysql JSON field search

Parameters

string $field

Field call
mixed $value

Value to match against the field

Returns

mixed —

Array or string given the value type

Tags

method

jsonStatement
version 1.0.0
since 1.0.0

jsonselect()

jsonselect(string|array  $fields, string  $separator = '_') : \Lqdt\Coj\ORM\jsonQuery

Adds support to fetch selected properties within a JSON field

The returned property name will be aliased by replacing @ and . with _ bye default to avoid errors. Custom separator string can be provided

Parameters

string|array $fields

Field name in datfield notation
string $separator

Separator sting for field aliases name (dot is not allowed)

Returns

\Lqdt\Coj\ORM\jsonQuery —

Self for chaining

Tags

method

jsonselect
version 1.0.0
since 1.0.0

jsonExpression()

jsonExpression(array|string  $conditions, string  $operand = 'AND', boolean  $not = false) : \Cake\Database\Expression\QueryExpression

Build a QueryExpression object given the conditions input while parsing dotted fields as JSON_EXTRACT short notation.

The conditions are evaluated with jsonStatement to fit JSON search compatibility

Parameters

array|string $conditions

Conditions for WHERE clause
string $operand

value for QueryExpression::setConjunction. It can be OR or AND
boolean $not

If true, the condition(s) will be negate by a NOT()

Returns

\Cake\Database\Expression\QueryExpression —

CakePHP QueryExpression object usable with Query::where

Tags

method

jsonExpression
version 1.0.0
since 1.0.0
